intro: Mespilodaphne rigens, commonly known as the rigid mespilodaphne, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are small drupes that mature to a reddish color, often containing a single seed. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and understudied species in botanical research.
